definition: to enhance by contrast/to set off/to serve as a background in order to bring out the subject with greater brilliance/to serve as a prop/a foil
to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
(of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially

sentences.english: The frame sets off your painting very well.
sentences.chinese: 这个框把你的画陪衬得很美。

sentences.english: Such loves are always accompanied by such friendships.
sentences.chinese: 那种爱情总是有那种友谊陪衬着的。

sentences.english: To spend to have handsome foil, foil look.
sentences.chinese: 好花要有帅哥陪衬，陪衬一下。

sentences.english: To spend to have handsome foil, foil look.
sentences.chinese: 好花要有帅哥陪衬，陪衬一下。

sentences.english: But there is a political subplot here that we simply can't ignore.
sentences.chinese: 但是这里有一个我们不能忽视的政治陪衬情节。

sentences.english: People take it for granted that fatties are born to make slender people look good.
sentences.chinese: 人们想当然的认为胖子就是给美女做陪衬的。

sentences.english: Her yellow swimsuit serves as a perfect foil to her bronzed skin.
sentences.chinese: 黄色的泳衣与她铜色的肌肤是完美的陪衬。

sentences.english: The main melody is very clear, and the supporting voice simply throws it into relief.
sentences.chinese: 它的主要特征是主调鲜明突出，支声仅起陪衬作用。

sentences.english: Let hime solo, and you go along.
sentences.chinese: 让他一个人演独角戏吧，你就陪衬一下。

sentences.english: In the blue sky there are many white clouds. So nice!
sentences.chinese: 蓝莹莹的天空陪衬着雪白的云，煞是好看。

definition: supporting role (in play, film etc)/minor role/to play a secondary role (in business etc)/to play second fiddle
background (of a painting)/backdrop/a foil (to set off something to advantage)/to offset (something to advantage)
lit. the voice of the guest overwhelms that of the host (idiom)/fig. a minor player upstages the main attraction/minor details obscure the main point/the sauce is better than the fish
the brush stroke that dots in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
lit. on brocade, add flowers (idiom); to decorate sth already perfect/gilding the lily
to steal the show/to grab the limelight
to lose one's splendor/to lose luster/to be eclipsed/to be overshadowed
to set off by contrast/antithesis/analogy parallelism (linguistics)
to contrast/to set off one another/to go well with
to paint a dragon and dot in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
